variant.question: For an IFR flight to an airport equipped with navaids, the estimated time of arrival is the estimated time at which the aircraft will

options.text: arrive overhead the initial approach fix.
leave the initial approach fix to start the final approach.

options.text: Where 50 m obstacle clearance is obtained and can be maintained.
At the point where the climb is established.
Where the turn towards the IAF is made.

 Operational margin: 33 ftWhat is the correct approach minimum?
What happens during the intermediate segment of an instrument approach?

options.text: Aircraft speed and configuration are adjusted to prepare for the final approach
The aircraft is aligned with the runway and descent for landing is made.
The aircraft climbs to acheive a safe height of 50m
The aircraft is manoeuvring to enter the arrival segment

variant.question: For precision approaches, the Final Approach Point (FAP) is set at a specified distance from the threshold of the instrument runway. What is the maximum this distance can be?
Where is the Intermediate Fix (IF) located?

options.text: At the end of the initial segment.
At the end of the intermediate segment.
In the middle, between the initial approach fix (IAF) and the final approach fix (FAF).
Between the final approach fix (FAF) and the runway threshold.

variant.question: At which location can an IAF be found?

options.text: At the end of a STAR.
At the beginning of a FAS.
At the initial point of the intermediate approach segment.
At the beginning of a STAR.

variant.question: Towards the end of a long flight the IAF marks the:

options.text: beginning of the intermediate approach segment
end of the initial approach segment

variant.question: In an instrument approach procedure, what is the name of the segment connecting the initial and final segments?
Where does the initial approach segment in an instrument approach procedure start and end?
What is the purpose of the intermediate segment of an instrument approach?

options.text: This is the segment in which speed and configuration are adjusted.
This is the segment in which gear and flaps are retracted.
This is the segment in which alignment and descent for landing are made.
This is the segment where aircraft are normally required to hold before landing.

variant.question: An A320 is on its final approach at an intermediate altitude, on a precision instrument approach. This means that the aircraft is at or past the:
In precision approach procedures, the FAP is a point...

options.text: In space on the final approach track where the intermediate approach altitude/height intercepts the nominal glide path.
Sited on the final approach track at a distance that permits selection of final approach configuration, and descent from intermediate approach altitude to the appropriate MDA.
In an instrument approach procedure at which the prescribed missed approach procedure must be initiated in order to ensure minimum obstacle clearance.
That marks the end of an initial segment and the beginning of the intermediate segment of the precision approach.

variant.question: Approach procedures and approach segment (ILS). ILS obstacle clearance surfaces are established under the assumption that the pilot does not allow the aircraft to deviate from the centreline by more than...”

options.text: half a scale deflection after being established on the track.
a quarter of a scale deflection after being established on the track.
one and a half scales deflection after being established on the track.
one full scale deflection after being established on the track.

variant.question: What is the primary area during the intermediate section of an instrument approach?

options.text: 1/2 of the total width of the airspace used to determine the minimum obstacle clearance for the approach.
3/4 of the total width of the airspace used to determine the minimum obstacle clearance for the approach.
10 NM either side of the approach path.
1/4 of the total width of the airspace used to determine the minimum obstacle clearance for the approach.

variant.question: In an instrument approach procedure, the segment in which alignment and descent for landing are made is called:
Where does an 'arrival route' normally end?
You are flying an ILS approach in IMC conditions when the Glide Path (GP) signal is lost.What will you do?

options.text: If time permits, revert to the published LOC approach procedure, or go around.
Maintain the current vertical speed, and continue descending until the ILS minima.
It is mandatory to perform a missed approach if the GP signal fails.
Continue down until the standby GP transmitter on the ground takes over.

variant.question: In an instrument approach, the Intermediate Fix (IF) is the

options.text: end of the initial approach segment.
end of the intermediate approach segment.
point located half-way between the Initial and Final Fixes.
beginning of the initial approach segment.

variant.question: In this approach segment, the aircraft has left the en-route structure and is manoeuvring to enter the intermediate approach segment. Aircraft speed and configuration will depend on the distance from the aerodrome, and the descent required. Which approach segment has been described?
What is FAP?

options.text: A point in space on the final approach track where the intermediate approach altitude/height intercepts the nominal glide path/microwave landing system (MLS) elevation angle.
It identifies the beginning of the intermediate approach segment of an instrument approach procedure.
It is the point of intersection of an electronic glide path with the applicable DA/H in APV or precision approaches
It is designed to place the aircraft on the localizer or the MLS azimuth specified for the final approach track.

variant.question: What is the maximum interception angle between the initial and intermediate segment for a precision approach?

options.text: Initial Approach Fix (IAF) and Intermediate Fix (IF).
Initial Approach Fix (IAF)and Final Approach Fix (FAF).

variant.question: Which answer best applies to the initial approach segment?

options.text: It commences at the initial approach fix and ends at the intermediate fix
It ends at the initial approach fix
It starts the whole arrival procedure and ends as the intermediate segment begins.
the initial segment is followed by the arrival segment

variant.question: The BISBA3Y Standard Instrument Arrival (STAR) ends at the LESBA waypoint. – LESBA is the?

options.text: Is aligned and is making the final descent for landing.
Has to descend at 1000 feet per minute.
Is flying level and reducing speed for final descent.
Has left the en-route structure and is preparing for final.

variant.question: State what happens if an ILS glide path (GP) becomes inoperative during the approach:

options.text: A go-around should be initiated, or, if time permits, the approach can be continued by using the LOC signals.
A missed approach must be initiated.
ATC should be contacted for further instructions.
It must be continued to the ILS minimum without GP.

What is the missed approach point in an instrument approach procedure?

options.text: It is where the final approach segment terminates.
It is a point determined by the pilot for initiating a missed approach, if the approach CANNOT be continued.
It is where the decision point is located.
It is the point where the pilot would initiate a missed approach, if the approach CANNOT be continued.

variant.question: On an instrument approach, the Initial Approach Fix (IAF) marks the..

initial point of the Standard Instrument Arrival (STAR).
end point of the Initial Segment.

makes the alignment and descend for landing.
is configured and makes the alignment for landing.
leaves the en-route segment and starts the approach segment.

options.text: For aircraft alignment and descent for landing.
For speed adjustment and to configure the aircraft for landing.
To transition from the en-route phase to the approach phase.
To join the airways system with the ILS procedure.

Definitions- Final Approach and Take-off Area (FATO)

options.text: A defined area over which the final phase of the approach manoeuvre to hover or landing is completed and from which the take-off manoeuvre is commenced.
A defined area over which the initial phase of the approach manoeuvre to hover or landing is completed and from which the take-off manoeuvre is completed.
an area where an extended line drawn 900m from either side of the runway and measuring 60m wide
A defined area over which the final phase of the approach manoeuvre to hover or landing is completed.
